intro: Lesquerella hitchcockii subsp. confluens, commonly known as the narrowleaf lesquerella, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crop species. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils. The seeds of this species contain valuable oils used in industrial applications.
